Articles.Content:
Yo! This is probably not gonna get to them, but I just wanted to thank the devs for their AMAZING work. Ksp is the best game that I've ever played, and if someone who knows one of the Ksp team if you could pass on this message to them, that would be great!

Keep doing Amazing stuff Guys!

This stuff does (eventually) get to them, and they really appreciate it.

Edit: But it gets there faster if you poke @sal_vager.

Edited February 13, 2017 by Arsonide
Heh yeah, I pass these on whenever I see them
What? Is it not obvious that through our endless complaining and criticism of whatever Squad does we mean KSP is one of the best games we've ever played?

KSP still feels to me as if Squad made it specifically for me. So I find it even more amazing that so many others like it, too!

Also, let me use this space to say that I think that the Maneuver Node in the map view alone is a huge accomplishment in user interface design, that cannot be overrated. Reducing much of the complexity of orbital mechanics to a screen element with 6 colorful twiddlethingies to play with, while the resulting trajectory is plotted in realtime, is just great.

That this idea seems so obvious to us now only illustrates how innovative it really is.

Excellent point.

For me, and I dont know how much of a common problem in computer science or simulation this is, but I find it quite fascinating how they work with 3D coordinates that have to be accurate to the millimetre in a space that is light-minutes across with a floating-point system with only 10ish(?) significant figures.

As far as I know, this is one of the core problems with designing a physics engine capable of running a KSP-like sim.

**edit**

...and is why choosing [or converting to] an engine other than unity [eg: unreal engine] would make little difference, all the same difficulties would still be there.

Edited February 16, 2017 by p1t1o

Me too! I was literally looking for a game where you could build your own spaceship. For, like, months. And somehow I only catch it at the tail end of 0.18.

*Poke poke*

Well if this is guna be seen eventually by the devs, I may as well throw out my support/thanks to them as well.
Loving the game, 230+ hours in and hanging out for the future plans/updates (and I've only just started toying with SSTOs!)

I mean, I always did want a reason to set up a satellite network around the Kerbol system, now I can make all the satellites I want thanks to 1.2 (I need to find more excuses to use xenon gas!)

I also had this tab open and it got lost in all the open tabs in my browser for at least the past 2 days. I'll just add that positive feedback is always welcome, keeps us going and it's always appreciated. Thanks for the thoughts.
